item.title: Bridge Between Crimea and Russia Disabled in Presumed Ukrainian Strikes
item.description: The attack marked the second time the bridge had been hit, potentially constraining Russian logistics on front lines in southern Ukraine.

item.title: Metals Slip After Underwhelming China GDP Data
item.description: Base metals fell in early London trading as Chinese GDP data raised questions about its demand for metals.

item.title: Oil Falls After China's GDP Misses Forecasts
item.description: Oil prices declined in Europe after Chinese GDP data was weaker than expected and on reports that some shuttered oil wells in Libya reopened.

item.title: TomTom Shares Jump on Guidance Hike
item.description: TomTom raised its full-year revenue outlook to €570-600 million after second-quarter revenue rose 18% on a good performance from its location technology business.

item.title: Taiwan's Vice President Plans Stop in the U.S. at a Delicate Moment
item.description: Taiwan’s vice president plans to visit the U.S. in August, less than five months after a similar visit by the island democracy’s president sparked an angry response from Beijing.

item.title: Dollar Weakness Might Not Last Long
item.description: Signs of U.S. disinflation and skepticism about whether the Fed can raise interest rates beyond July should keep the dollar weak in the near term but it could pick up later in the year, Rabobank said, expecting EUR/USD to fall to 1.08 in three months and 1.06 in six months.

item.title: Chinese Shares Extend Losses After 2Q GDP Miss
item.description: Chinese shares ended lower, extending morning losses after GDP data and a series of other economic indicators added to evidence of China’s fading post-Covid recovery momentum.

item.title: Spanish Government Bond Underperformance Expected to Fade in 2H
item.description: The recent underperformance of Spanish government bonds compared with peers is partly due to political uncertainty, but this is likely to fade with supply dynamics looking constructive in the second half of the year, Morgan Stanley said.

item.title: Analysis: Snap Election in Spain May Give Spanish Bonds a Boost
item.description: Spanish government bonds are set to outperform some of their eurozone peers in the coming quarters and an expected victory for the conservative People’s Party in next weekend’s election could lend an additional boost, analysts said.

item.title: Nordea Lifts Guidance After Strong Second Quarter
item.description: Nordea Bank forecast a return on equity above 15% for 2023 and said it was reassessing its long-term financial targets after it posted a forecast-beating second-quarter net profit.

item.title: Richemont Sales Rise But Miss Forecasts
item.description: Richemont posted sales of €5.3 billion in the first quarter, with Asia-Pacific rebounding strongly and more than offsetting a muted performance in the Americas.

item.title: AngloPlat Warns of Earnings Slide
item.description: Anglo American Platinum forecast a 65%-75% drop in first-half basic and headline earnings on lower palladium prices, a weaker exchange rate and reduced sales.

item.title: China's Economy Barely Grows as Recovery Fades
item.description: China’s economy barely grew in the second quarter from the first and youth unemployment hit a record high in June, evidence of a fading recovery that risks leaving the global economy underpowered.

item.title: Hong Kong Trading Session Canceled Due to Typhoon
item.description: UPDATED: The Hong Kong stock exchange canceled trading on Monday due to the city’s typhoon alert.

item.title: Jane Birkin, the British-born actress and singer who rose to fame in the late 1960s and inspired the iconic Hermès handbag named after her, died Sunday at the age of 76.
item.description: Jane Birkin, the British-born actress and singer who rose to fame in the late 1960s and inspired the iconic Hermès handbag named after her, died Sunday at the age of 76.

item.title: Box-office receipts for the new "Mission Impossible" made it the weekend's top performer, but it trailed other movies this summer.
item.description: Box-office receipts for the new “Mission Impossible” made it the weekend’s top performer, but it trailed other movies this summer.

item.title: Economic indicators are giving investors hope that the Fed might be able to contain pricing pressures without tipping the economy into recession.
item.description: Economic indicators are giving investors hope that the Fed might be able to contain pricing pressures without tipping the economy into recession.

item.title: China's economy barely grew in the second quarter and youth unemployment soared to a record in June, evidence of a fading recovery that risks leaving the global economy underpowered.
item.description: China’s economy barely grew in the second quarter and youth unemployment soared to a record in June, evidence of a fading recovery that risks leaving the global economy underpowered.

item.title: Cathie Wood's flagship ARK Innovation exchange-traded fund has rallied more than 50% this year and investors are using that gain as an opportunity to get out.
item.description: Cathie Wood’s flagship ARK Innovation exchange-traded fund has rallied more than 50% this year and investors are using that gain as an opportunity to get out.

item.title: Russia is poised to end its cooperation at the U.N. in key humanitarian areas as the Kremlin faces a difficult fight in Ukraine and is eager to shore up support at home amid recent domestic instability, Western officials said.
item.description: Russia is poised to end its cooperation at the U.N. in key humanitarian areas as the Kremlin faces a difficult fight in Ukraine and is eager to shore up support at home amid recent domestic instability, Western officials said.
